item.title: 交通技术公司 Via 提交首次公开募股申请，显示亏损收窄
item.description: Via Transportation Inc. 公开提交了首次公开募股申请，这家公共交通规划和调度软件制造商有望在 9 月份的新股上市潮中独占鳌头。【原文：Via Transportation Inc. filed publicly for an IPO, positioning the public transport planning and scheduling software maker to lead a potentially busy September for new listings.】

item.title: 巴克莱出售泰晤士河水务公司债务，救援谈判仍在继续
item.description: 巴克莱银行（Barclays Plc）正在出售泰晤士水务公司（Thames Water）2.36 亿英镑（约合 3.2 亿美元）的债务，因为这家陷入困境的水务运营商正与债权人就潜在的拯救方案进行谈判。【原文：Barclays Plc is selling £236 million ($320 million) of Thames Water debt as the struggling water operator is locked in talks with creditors over a potential rescue.】

item.title: 英特尔首席执行官的 "神奇故事 "让他成为亿万富翁
item.description:
根据彭博亿万富豪指数（Bloomberg Billionaires Index），这位65岁的技术和风险投资行业资深人士已经积累了至少11亿美元的财富。【原文：

The 65-year-old technology and venture capital industry veteran has amassed a fortune worth at least $1.1 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, which is calculating Lip-Bu Tan’s net worth for the first time.

】

item.title: 价格下跌，中国液化天然气买家抢购进口液化天然气以补充储量
item.description: 由于价格下跌和补充库存的需要，中国的液化天然气买家正在增加进口，结束了数月来低迷的交货量。【原文：China’s liquefied natural gas buyers are boosting imports as falling prices and the need to replenish inventories end months of sluggish deliveries.】

item.title: 乌克兰罢工后卢克石油公司主要炼油厂停止进油
item.description: 卢克石油公司（Lukoil PJSC）的主要炼油厂伏尔加格勒炼油厂在乌克兰无人机对俄罗斯能源资产进行一系列最新袭击后停止了石油开采。【原文：Lukoil PJSC’s major Volgograd refinery has halted oil intake following one of the latest in a series of Ukrainian drone strikes on Russian energy assets, said a person familiar with the matter, who asked not to be named discussing non-public information.】

item.title: OpenAI 的山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）预计将在基础设施上花费 "数万亿 "美元
item.description: OpenAI 首席执行官山姆-奥特曼（Sam Altman）希望在开发和运行人工智能服务所需的基础设施上长期投入数万亿美元。他只需要想办法筹集这笔资金。【原文：OpenAI Chief Executive Officer Sam Altman wants to spend trillions of dollars over time on the infrastructure required to develop and run artificial intelligence services. He just needs to figure out a way to raise that kind of money.】

item.title: 美国消费者信心下降，通胀预期上升
item.description: 由于对关税影响的忧虑挥之不去，美国消费者信心自 4 月份以来首次意外下降，通胀预期上升。【原文：US consumer sentiment unexpectedly fell for the first time since April and inflation expectations rose on lingering anxiety about the impact of tariffs.】

item.title: 特朗普政府希望为英特尔股权提供芯片法案基金
item.description: 据熟悉相关讨论的人士透露，特朗普政府正在考虑利用《美国芯片法案》（US Chips Act）的资金入股陷入困境的美国芯片制造商英特尔公司（Intel Corp.【原文：The Trump administration is considering using funds from the US Chips Act to take a stake in the beleaguered American chipmaker Intel Corp., according to people familiar with the discussions.】

item.title: 道指再创新高，交易员目光从科技转向蓝筹股
item.description: 周五，道琼斯工业平均指数有望创下收盘历史新高，因为在强劲的企业盈利以及贸易和地缘政治担忧消退的背景下，投资者纷纷涌入美国股市。【原文：The Dow Jones Industrial Average is on pace to close at an all-time high on Friday, as investors pile into US equities on the back of strong corporate earnings and ebbing trade and geopolitical fears.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比表示希望看到更多积极的通胀数据
item.description: 芝加哥联邦储备银行行长古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）表示，他希望至少再看到一份通胀报告，以确定持续的物价压力没有回升。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee said he would like to see at least one more inflation report to be sure persistent price pressures aren’t picking up.】

item.title: 惠勒卸任，Opendoor 寻找新首席执行官，股价上涨
item.description: Opendoor Technologies Inc., a real estate company that became a meme stock in recent months, said Chief Executive Officer Carrie Wheeler is stepping down immediately as the board searches for a replacement.

item.title: 迈克尔-赛勒押注千亿美元比特币 "信贷 "梦想
item.description: 迈克尔-赛勒（Michael Saylor）的职业生涯一直在测试信念能在多大程度上折服市场；他既是金融家，又是布道者。现在，这位战略公司（Strategy Inc.【原文：Michael Saylor has built a career on testing how far conviction can bend markets — part financier, part preacher. Now the Strategy Inc. chairman is betting that same belief on what may be his riskiest financing experiment yet.】

item.title: 零售销售缓解经济放缓担忧，美国股市保持稳定
item.description: 由于最新的零售销售数据有助于缓解人们对消费支出的担忧，美国股市周五继续创下历史新高。【原文：US stocks held onto record highs on Friday as the latest retail sales data helped ease concerns over consumer spending.】

item.title: 巴西糖业巨头 Raízen 如何成为一只细价股
item.description: 这只是巴西甘蔗产区中心地带的又一个星期二早晨，距离圣保罗四小时车程的小镇塞尔塔奥津霍的工人们听到了这个消息。【原文：It was just another Tuesday morning in the heart of Brazil’s sugarcane region when workers in Sertãozinho, a small town four hours away from Sao Paulo, heard the news.】

item.title: 工厂应对需求疲软，美国工业产出减少
item.description: 美国 7 月份工业生产下降，原因是需求降温和贸易政策变化导致制造商产出不振。【原文：US industrial production declined in July, restrained by tepid output among manufacturers pinched by cooler demand and shifting trade policy.】

item.title: 爱尔兰对美国的出口在关税激增后大幅下滑
item.description: 爱尔兰对美国的出口下降了23%，这表明跨国公司在今年早些时候美国宣布加征关税前出货量猛增后改变了方向。【原文：Exports from Ireland to the US sank by 23%, suggesting multinational companies shifted course after a jump in shipments before the announcement of tariffs earlier in the year.】

item.title: 尽管加征关税，加拿大工厂和批发商 6 月份仍实现增长
item.description: 加拿大最容易受到美国贸易战影响的两个行业在第二季度销售强劲，扭转了此前关税导致的下滑趋势。【原文：Two of Canada’s most vulnerable sectors to the US trade war ended the second quarter with strong sales, reversing an earlier tariff-driven slump.】

item.title: 美国零售销售额上调后大幅增长
item.description: 受汽车销售和大型在线促销活动的推动，美国 7 月份零售销售额广泛增长，这表明近几个月来消费者加大了消费力度。【原文：US retail sales rose in July in a broad-based advance, boosted by car sales and major online promotions in a sign consumers stepped up their spending in recent months.】

item.title: 罗布斯塔咖啡将因顶级种植国的供应困境而每周跳涨
item.description: 罗布斯塔咖啡在伦敦有望创下二十多年来的最大单周涨幅，因为两大生产商对供应紧张的担忧使市场始终处于紧张状态。【原文：Robusta coffee was on track for the biggest weekly gain in more than two decades in London, as concerns over tight supplies from the two largest producers keep the market on edge.】

item.title: 尼日利亚通胀再次放缓，为降息提供依据
item.description: 尼日利亚 7 月份的年通胀率连续第四个月放缓，这为央行开始削减创历史新高的借贷成本提供了更多理由。【原文：Nigerian annual inflation slowed for a fourth consecutive month in July, strengthening the case for the central bank to begin cutting borrowing costs that are at a record high.】

item.title: 萨默林称，如果 10 年期收益率上升，美联储将需要停止缩表
item.description: 被视为美联储主席候选人的经济学家马克-萨默林（Marc Sumerlin）表示，政策制定者应在下个月降低利率，但他提醒说，如果长期国债收益率上升，政策制定者将不得不停止降息。【原文：Economist Marc Sumerlin, viewed as a candidate to chair the Federal Reserve, said policymakers should slash interest rates next month, but cautioned that they would have to stop if longer-term Treasury yields rose.】

item.title: 中国经济遭遇 2025 年最糟糕的一个月，刺激政策重新发挥作用
item.description: 中国经济在 7 月份出现了今年以来最严重的放缓，这使人们更加期待中国政府在今年推出更多刺激措施，以抵消唐纳德-特朗普贸易战的影响。【原文：China’s economy clocked its deepest slowdown of the year in July, raising expectations for Beijing to roll out more stimulus this year to offset the impact of Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 据说 Advent 将考虑收购瑞士芯片制造商 U-blox
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Advent 公司正在制定收购 U-blox Holding AG 公司的方案，这笔交易对这家瑞士定位芯片制造商的估值可能超过 10 亿瑞士法郎（约合 12 亿美元）。【原文：Advent is working on an offer to acquire U-blox Holding AG in a deal that could value the Swiss maker of positioning chips at more than 1 billion Swiss francs ($1.2 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 爱丽舍表示，马克龙和泽伦斯基将在阿拉斯加会谈后会晤
item.description: 法国总统府表示，埃马纽埃尔-马克龙总统和沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基总统将在周五阿拉斯加美俄会谈后举行会晤。【原文：Presidents Emmanuel Macron and Volodymyr Zelenskiy will hold a meeting after Friday’s US-Russia talks in Alaska, the French presidency said.】

item.title: 遗产税投票前，前皮克泰特老板离开瑞士
item.description: 在即将举行的关于增加遗产税的投票之前，瑞士的一位顶级私人银行家已经搬到了意大利。【原文：One of Switzerland’s top private bankers has moved to Italy, ahead of an upcoming vote on increasing inheritance tax.】

item.title: 加里-内维尔称美国投资者将继续收购英格兰足球俱乐部
item.description: 英格兰足球队索尔福德城的共同所有人加里-内维尔（Gary Neville）表示，美国投资者将继续投资英格兰的俱乐部。【原文：Gary Neville, co-owner of English football team Salford City, said American investors will continue to invest in the country’s clubs.】

item.title: 穆德里克说，利率上调拓宽了受困者的选择范围
item.description: 自 2009 年杰森-穆德里克（Jason Mudrick）成立他的基金穆德里克资本管理公司（Mudrick Capital Management）以来，不良债务投资领域已经发生了三大变化：私募股权在经济中扮演了更重要的角色；低利率鼓励了各行各业的高杠杆资本结构；金融文件越来越薄弱。【原文：Since 2009, when Jason Mudrick set up his fund Mudrick Capital Management, the world of distressed debt investing has seen three major changes: private equity plays a larger role in the economy, low rates have encouraged highly leveraged capital structures across sectors and there’s weaker financial documentation.】

item.title: 让奥斯特成为风电巨头的融资工具也毁了它
item.description:
丹麦开发商利用 "农场降价 "来推动增长，但价格和利率的上涨颠覆了这一模式。【原文：

The Danish developer used ‘farm downs’ to fuel growth, but rising prices and interest rates upended that model.

】

item.title: 人工智能音乐无处不在，却越来越难以发现
item.description: 欢迎阅读 Tech In Depth，这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃伦-休特（Ellen Huet）对人工智能生成的音乐进行了调查，发现其进步速度惊人。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ellen Huet checks in on AI-generated music and finds its rate of improvement striking.】
